title: Koumei Oda
text:
is a Japanese professional <a href="golf">golf</a>er.
Oda was born in <a href="Tagawa%2C%20Fukuoka">Tagawa, Fukuoka</a>. He turned professional in 2000.
Oda won the 2008 <a href="Casio%20World%20Open">Casio World Open</a> and the 2009 <a href="Token%20Homemate%20Cup">Token Homemate Cup</a>. He competed in the <a href="2009%20Open%20Championship">2009 Open Championship</a> at Turnberry, but failed to make the cut, finishing day two at 14 over par. He retained the Casio World Open in 2009 and the Token Homemate Cup in 2010. In 2011, he won the <a href="Diamond%20Cup%20Golf">Diamond Cup Golf</a> for his fifth Japan Golf Tour win. In September 2013, Oda won the <a href="ANA%20Open">ANA Open</a>, the victory was his sixth on the <a href="Japan%20Golf%20Tour">Japan Golf Tour</a>. In May 2014, Oda won the <a href="Kansai%20Open%20Golf%20Championship">Kansai Open Golf Championship</a> for his seventh Japan Golf Tour win. He would follow with his eighth victory on tour later that year in October, when he won the <a href="Bridgestone%20Open">Bridgestone Open</a>.
